snippet: Some federal civil trials may have to be suspended because of budget cuts that Congress has scheduled to take effect in January, the federal judiciary’s policy-making body said.
abstract: Judicial Conference of the United States, made up of judges from around the country, says some federal civil trials may have to be suspended because of budget cuts that Congress has scheduled to take effect in January 2013.
lead_paragraph: Some federal civil trials may have to be suspended because of budget cuts that Congress has scheduled to take effect in January, the federal judiciary’s policy-making body said.

headline.seo: Federal Judges Warn of Effects of Planned Budget Cuts
headline.main: Federal Judges Warn of Planned Budget Cuts’ Impact
headline.print_headline: Federal Judges Warn of Effects of Planned Budget Cuts
